title: Is Human Data Enough? With David Silver

mind welcome back to Google Deep Mind

the era of human data which is that all
of these AI methods they're based on one
common idea which is we extract every
piece of knowledge that humans have and
you kind of feed it into the machine and
that's one incredibly powerful way to do
things there's another way to do things
and this is what's going to lead us into
the era of experience which is where the
machine
actually interacts with the world itself
and it generates its own experience it
tries things out in the world and it
starts to build up its own experience
and if you think of that data as fueling
the machine then that will lead to um
this next generation of AI that we can

guess this is in a way you're sort of
thumping the table saying large language
models are not the only AI right like
there are alternatives there are
different ways that we can approach this
i think we've we've really got a lot out

natural language data that's out there
and kind of assimilating that all into a

we're going to need a different type of

knowledge if if you're not copying

what happens is that actually that makes

that's picking the moves what you want

single point that you're offering how do

right that you could have had you know
100 or 200 or 300 different moves and
then at the end you just get one bit of

alph Go played on the fifth line and it

it kind of connected everything together
